Class SudokuBoard

java.lang.Object
com.example.miniproyecto2pruebas.model.SudokuBoard
public class SudokuBoard extends Object
The SudokuBoard class represents the game board of a Sudoku puzzle. It provides methods for manipulating and solving the Sudoku puzzle.
Since:
1.0
Version:
3.0
Author:
Juan Pablo Piedrahita and David Taborda.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    SudokuBoard()
    Constructor that initializes an empty 6x6 Sudoku board with all cells set to 0.

  • Constructor Details

    • SudokuBoard

      public SudokuBoard()
      Constructor that initializes an empty 6x6 Sudoku board with all cells set to 0.

  • Method Details

    • fillRandomTwoNumbersPerBlock

      public void fillRandomTwoNumbersPerBlock()
      Fills two random cells in each 2x3 block with numbers from 1 to 6. The numbers are placed in such a way that no two numbers repeat in the row, column, or block.

    • getNumberAt

      public int getNumberAt(int row, int col)
      Gets the number at a specific position in the board.
      Parameters:
      row - The row index of the cell.
      col - The column index of the cell.
      Returns:
      The number at the specified position.

    • setNumberAt

      public void setNumberAt(int row, int col, int num)
      Sets a number at a specific position in the board.
      Parameters:
      row - The row index of the cell.
      col - The column index of the cell.
      num - The number to set at the specified position.

    • isSafe

      public boolean isSafe(int row, int col, int num)
      Checks if it is safe to place a number at the given row and column position. It ensures that the number does not already exist in the row, column, or 2x3 block.
      Parameters:
      row - The row index of the cell.
      col - The column index of the cell.
      num - The number to check.
      Returns:
      true if it is safe to place the number, false otherwise.

    • printBoard

      public void printBoard()
      Prints the current state of the Sudoku board to the console.

    • solve

      public boolean solve()
      Solves the Sudoku board using a backtracking algorithm.
      Returns:
      true if the board can be solved, false otherwise.

    • isRowValid

      public boolean isRowValid(int row, int col, int num)
      Checks if placing a number in the given row is valid by ensuring the number does not repeat in the row.
      Parameters:
      row - The row index of the cell.
      col - The column index of the cell.
      num - The number to check.
      Returns:
      true if the number is valid for the row, false otherwise.

    • isColumnValid

      public boolean isColumnValid(int row, int col, int num)
      Checks if placing a number in the given column is valid by ensuring the number does not repeat in the column.
      Parameters:
      row - The row index of the cell.
      col - The column index of the cell.
      num - The number to check.
      Returns:
      true if the number is valid for the column, false otherwise.

    • isBlockValid

      public boolean isBlockValid(int row, int col, int num)
      Checks if placing a number in the given 2x3 block is valid by ensuring the number does not repeat in the block.
      Parameters:
      row - The row index of the cell.
      col - The column index of the cell.
      num - The number to check.
      Returns:
      true if the number is valid for the block, false otherwise.
